name: Kanzashi Hair Sticks - Pointed petals
description: My fabulous kanzashi are now available on hair sticks -HURRAH!! These pieces are made to order and will take 1 week to complete before posting. Please note this listing is for pointed petaled flowers. Round petals are available here: http://www.cuttlefishlove.co.uk/product/kanzashi-hair-sticks-round-petals

name: Kanzashi Hair Sticks - Round petals
description: My fabulous kanzashi are now available on hair sticks -HURRAH!! These pieces are made to order and will take 1 week to complete before posting. Please note this listing is for round petaled flowers. Pointed petals are available here: http://www.cuttlefishlove.co.uk/product/kanzashi-hair-sticks-pointed-petals

name: Small Kanzashi Flowers - Brooches/Hairclips - Round Petals- Choose your colour
description:
These cute little flowers come in such stunning shades! They can be worn as both a brooch or a hairclip.

All pieces are made to order, please allow 1 week from date of payment, for the item to be made before it is posted.

All flowers are small-medium (2.5 inches diameter), 5 or 6 petal flowers made of habotai silk or polysilk

Each piece is backed with both a brooch finding and crocodile hair clip. If you would prefer a brooch backing only or a hair clip only please mention it when you order.

Please mention your choice of stamen colour when you order, otherwise you will receive a random colour. Please choose from Black, white, pale pink, pale purple, purple, grey, pale brown, ivory stamens or a gold beadcap. 

Please bear in mind that the colours you see on your screen may not exactly match the appearance of the kanzashi 'in the flesh', though I have tried to show them as accurately as possible!


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Kanzashi are Japanese hair ornaments. Hana kanzashi means ‘flower kanzashi’ and simply refers to the flower shape of the hair accessories. Tsumami kanzashi means kanzashi that are made by pinching silk to form petals and is the Japanese traditional craft which inspires my own kanzashi.

If you would like a custom kanzashi made in a flower or cluster shape, according to an existing design of mine, in the colours of your choosing, please get in touch with me via Etsy conversations. I am also happy to undertake more complex bespoke orders, such as bridal fascinators, boutonnières, corsages and bouquets. Just get in touch to discuss what you are interested in!

Have any questions? Contact the shop owner.

name: Small Kanzashi Hair Flowers / Hair Clips / Brooches -Pointed Petals - Choose your own colour

name: Ombre Fascinator - 2 Layer Ombre Kanzashi Flower Headpiece - Choose your colour
description:
Made with a mixture of finest quality Japanese habotai silk and polyester polysilk. These kanzashi hair clips are inspired by my love of all things ombre (fade from one colour to another) so I decided to make some ombre kanzashi flowers myself! The additional colour give more texture to the piece, making a more subtle item than a plain coloured kanzashi.

All pieces are made to order. Please allow 1 week from date of payment  for the item to be made before it is posted.


All flowers are large (4 inches diameter), 16 petal flowers with 2 layers of 8 petals around, made with a mixture of silk and polysilk. 

Each piece is backed with a crocodile hair clip. If you would like me to add a brooch back as well please mention it when you order.

Please mention your choice of stamen colour when you order, otherwise you will receive a random colour. Please choose from Black, white, pale pink, pale purple, purple, red, bright pink, grey, pale brown, ivory stamens or a gold beadcap.

Please bear in mind that the colours you see on your screen may not exactly match the appearance of the kanzashi 'in the flesh', though I have tried to show them as accurately as possible! 

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Kanzashi are Japanese hair ornaments. Hana kanzashi means ‘flower kanzashi’ and simply refers to the flower shape of the hair accessories. Tsumami kanzashi means kanzashi that are made by pinching silk to form petals and is the Japanese traditional craft which inspires my own kanzashi.

If you would like a custom kanzashi made in a flower or cluster shape, according to an existing design of mine, in the colours of your choosing, please get in touch with me via the 'Contact' button. I am also happy to undertake more complex bespoke orders, such as bridal fascinators, boutonnières, corsages and bouquets. Just get in touch to discuss what you are interested in!

description: These large fascinators are perfect for a bride who wants a unique fascinator that can be matched to her colour scheme, or for anyone who wants something a bit different from 'just an ordinary fascinator' An extra large (4.5 inches diameter), 24 petal flower with 4 layers of 6 petals around. Please mention your choice of stamen colour when you order, otherwise you will receive a random colour. Please choose from Black, white, pale pink, pale purple, purple, red, bright pink, grey, pale brown, ivory stamens or a gold beadcap. name: Yellow and Pink Kanzashi Flower Brooch Pin: Kanzashi Corsage in Yellow and Fuchsia
description:
Popping with almost acid colours, this handmade kanzashi flower brooch is a true reflection of the colours I Handmade by me using habotai silk and Japanese kimono print cotton with a chrysanthemum and temari balls, this gorgeously bright kanzashi corsage is a must for colourlovers like myself! Make your style pop!

A medium (3 inches diameter), 12 petal flower made of fuschia habotai silk and yellowJapanese kimono print cotton.

There are grey stamens in the middle and it is backed with grey felt and a brooch pin.

Please bear in mind that the colours you see on your screen may not exactly match the appearance of the kanzashi 'in the flesh', though I have tried to show them as accurately as possible!

Kanzashi are Japanese hair ornaments. Hana kanzashi means ‘flower kanzashi’ and simply refers to the flower shape of the hair accessories. Tsumami kanzashi means kanzashi that are made by pinching silk to form petals and is the Japanese traditional craft which inspires my own kanzashi.

name: Waterlily Kanzashi Flower Hairclip: Fascinator in Mint Green, Ivory, Pink and Cerise
description:
This fabric flower kanzashi hairclip is muted sorbet colours, and has a beautiful zen feel to it. This large kanzashi fascinator is made with polysilk to keep it affordable. A beautiful waterlily-like kanzashi flower, you can imagine this floating on the surface of a still pond. 

An extra large (4.5 inches diameter), 24 petal flower with 3 layers of 8 petals around.

There are pale pink stamens in the middle and it is backed with cerise felt and a crocodile hair clip.

The petals are: 
Centre layer: Fuchsia habotai silk
2nd layer: Pink Polysilk
3rd layer: 6 ivory polysilk petals, 2 mint green polysilk petals



Please bear in mind that the colours you see on your screen may not exactly match the appearance of the kanzashi 'in the flesh', though I have tried to show them as accurately as possible!

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Kanzashi are Japanese hair ornaments. Hana kanzashi means ‘flower kanzashi’ and simply refers to the flower shape of the hair accessories. Tsumami kanzashi means kanzashi that are made by pinching silk to form petals and is the Japanese traditional craft which inspires my own kanzashi.

I am also happy to undertake more complex bespoke orders, such as bridal fascinators, boutonnières, corsages and bouquets. Just get in touch to discuss what you are interested in!

name: Waterlily Kanzashi Flower Fascinator in Aqua and Pale Blue Silk - Extra Large
description:
As featured here: http://issuu.com/rebel-magazine/docs/graduatecollections/61

This fabric flower kanzashi hairclip is made with habotai silk, which gives it a wonderful softness and lustrous colour. The method of folding the silk squares by hand is time consuming and detailed, but gives a unique three-dimensional effect.

Wear as a wedding headbpiece, or a bridal fascinator, for a truly unique look. 

This piece is made to order, so please allow 1 week for the item to be made before it is posted.

An extra large (5 inches diameter), 32 petal flower with 4 layers of 8 petals around.

There are pale pink stamens in the middle and it is backed with pale grey felt and a crocodile hair clip.

The petals are: 
Centre layer: Fuchsia silk 
2nd layer: 6 aqua silk petals, 2 white silk petals 
3rd layer: 6 aqua silk petals, 2 white silk petals 
4th layer: 6 aqua silk petals, 2 white silk petals


Please bear in mind that the colours you see on your screen may not exactly match the appearance of the kanzashi 'in the flesh', though I have tried to show them as accurately as possible!

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Kanzashi are Japanese hair ornaments. Hana kanzashi means ‘flower kanzashi’ and simply refers to the flower shape of the hair accessories. Tsumami kanzashi means kanzashi that are made by pinching silk to form petals and is the Japanese traditional craft which inspires my own kanzashi.

If you would like a custom kanzashi made in a flower or cluster shape, according to an existing design of mine, in the colours of your choosing, please get in touch with me via the 'Contact' button. I am also happy to undertake more complex bespoke orders, such as bridal fascinators, boutonnières, corsages and bouquets. Just get in touch to discuss what you are interested in!

name: Kanzashi Fascinator with Falls in Purple and Mauve Habotai Silk with Falls
description:
This piece is made to order please allow 2 weeks for the item to be completed before posting.

Made from habotai silk, giving it a soft texture and deep, lustrous colour, this elaborate kanzashi fascinator measures around 7 inches in length (including falls) and is 3.5 inches at the widest point. The small flowers are 1 inch across each and the central flower is 3 inches across.

Very labour intensive to produce, each tiny petal is handfolded from squares of silk. This is my most complex silk kanzashi flower to date and is inspired by the styles of kanzashi with falls worn in Japan by geisha and maiko. This will add an oriental feel to a western outfit or will perfectly complement a kimono or yukata.

The complexity of design makes it ideal as a wedding hair accessory, and the dangles will draw attention to the face of any blushing bride! Wearing a wedding kanzashi will make the bride look truly unique.

Silks used: Deep purple, mauve, oyster and taupe (all habotai).

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Kanzashi are Japanese hair ornaments. Hana kanzashi means ‘flower kanzashi’ and simply refers to the flower shape of the hair accessories. Tsumami kanzashi means kanzashi that are made by pinching silk to form petals and is the Japanese traditional craft which inspires my own kanzashi.

If you would like a custom kanzashi made in a flower or cluster shape, according to an existing design of mine, in the colours of your choosing, please get in touch with me via the 'Contact' button. I am also happy to undertake more complex bespoke orders, such as bridal fascinators, boutonnières, corsages and bouquets. Just get in touch to discuss what you are interested in!

name: Steampunk Kanzashi Fascinator in Burnt Gold and Turquoise Habotai Silk
description:
This steampunk kanzashi is really something special. Looking for a steampunk fascinator that's got something a bit different about it? Made up of 3 intricately folded kanzashi flowers in burnt gold, oyster grey, turquoise and aqua silk, it also uses found pieces of silver coloured jewelry (may be real silver but I suspect not!) to adorn and create a really lush and exotic twist to the general steampunk theme. These silver parts will move as you do, drawing the eye to your incredible headpiece.

3 paper clock faces (sprayed with a matt varnish for sturdiness) peek out from behind the main flower and pearl coloured beads and brass buttons add the finishing touches to this elaborate handmade piece.

The size of the whole piece is roughly 6.5 inches by 5inches (including the length of the dangles)
The flowers are:

Large flower - 3.5 inches diameter- Outer layer: Burnt gold silk (2 petals aqua silk), middle layer: oyster grey silk (2 petals light turquoise silk), inner layer: taupe silk (2 petals mid turquoise silk). Large brass button in the centre. An elaborate silver coloured (possibly real, but unlikely!) anklet from India is attached between the flower and the felt backing. 2 large crocodile clips are fixed to the back.

Medium Flower - nearly 3 inches diameter- Outer layer: Burnt gold silk. Inner layer: taupe silk. Pearl coloured bead in the centre. A silver coloured dangly earring is attached between the flower and the backing felt. and a crocodile clip is fixed on the back.

Small flower - nearly 2 inches diameter - Outer layer: burnt gold silk. Inner Layer: aqua silk. 3 small pearl coloured beads in the centre.

All flowers and clocks are backed with brown felt. Flowers and clocks are connected to the central flower with gold picture wire.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Kanzashi are Japanese hair ornaments. Hana kanzashi means ‘flower kanzashi’ and simply refers to the flower shape of the hair accessories. Tsumami kanzashi means kanzashi that are made by pinching silk to form petals and is the Japanese traditional craft which inspires my own kanzashi.

If you would like a custom kanzashi made in a flower or cluster shape, according to an existing design of mine, in the colours of your choosing, please get in touch with me via the 'Contact' button. I am also happy to undertake more complex bespoke orders, such as bridal fascinators, boutonnières, corsages and bouquets. Just get in touch to discuss what you are interested in!
